docs.snippet: A University of Richmond women's basketball assistant coach and team staff member were the passengers aboard a hot air balloon that drifted into a power line, burst into flames and crashed in Virginia....
docs.lead_paragraph: A University of Richmond women's basketball assistant coach and team staff member were the passengers aboard a hot air balloon that drifted into a power line, burst into flames and crashed in Virginia.

headline.main: U. Of Richmond: 2 Athletic Staffers on Va. Balloon

docs.snippet: Two months have passed since English soccer star David Beckham hopped on a stage, his back to Miami's sparkling Biscayne Bay, and announced plans to start a Major League Soccer franchise. The plan — and Beckham — have been almost unive...
docs.lead_paragraph: Two months have passed since English soccer star David Beckham hopped on a stage, his back to Miami's sparkling Biscayne Bay, and announced plans to start a Major League Soccer franchise. The plan — and Beckham — have been almost universally accepted by every sector of the city.

headline.main: Beckham Presses Forward With Miami Stadium Bid
headline.print_headline: Beckham Presses Forward With Miami Stadium Bid

docs.snippet: In a debate that is akin to an identity crisis, competitive birding, once seen as a refuge from the clatter of the modern world, is now debating how much it should embrace technology....
docs.abstract: In a debate that is akin to an identity crisis, competitive birding, once seen as a refuge from the clatter of the modern world, is now debating how much it should embrace technology.

headline.main: It’s Gadgets vs. Eyeballs as Two Species of Bird-Watchers Clash
headline.print_headline: It’s Gadgets vs. Eyeballs as Two Species of Bird-Watchers Clash

byline.original: By COREY KILGANNON and EMILY S. RUEB

docs.snippet: The league posted its constitution, which had long been confidential, on its website while it seeks to require Donald Sterling to sell the Los Angeles Clippers....
docs.lead_paragraph: The league posted its constitution, which had long been confidential, on its website while it seeks to require Donald Sterling to sell the Los Angeles Clippers.
docs.abstract: NBA posts its constitution, which had long remained confidential, on its website as it seeks to force Donald Sterling into selling the Los Angeles Clippers; document shows that Sterling's future will hinge on Article 13, which outlines circumstances under which ownership can be terminated; remains unclear how rules will affect Sterling's wife Rochelle, who co-owns team through trust and has pledged to keep control.

headline.main: Rare View Into Inner Workings of N.B.A.
headline.print_headline: Sterling Case Puts Murky Rules in Focus as N.B.A. Reveals Constitution
